title: Workaround for hangs of the docker_client in the facts genereation
last_comment:
Hi
  Since Facter::Util::Resolution is extended by Core::Execution (https://www.rubydoc.info/gems/facter/Facter/Util/Resolution)  i was sure that this should work the same.

My facter have to be to old for execute **timeout** option to work:
```
# cat  /var/lib/puppet/lib/facter/sleep.rb 
require 'facter'
Facter.add(:sleep) do
  setcode do
    begin
      Facter::Core::Execution.execute('sleep 10', options = {:timeout => 5})
      'did not timeout!'
    rescue Facter::Core::Execution::ExecutionFailure
      'timeout!'
    end
  end
end
```

```
# date; facter -p sleep; date
Mon Dec 23 14:49:23 UTC 2019
did not timeout!
Mon Dec 23 14:49:33 UTC 2019
```

```
# facter  -v
2.4.6
# facter  -p os 
{"name"=>"Ubuntu", "family"=>"Debian", "release"=>{"major"=>"16.04", "full"=>"16.04"}, "lsb"=>{"distcodename"=>"xenial", "distid"=>"Ubuntu", "distdescription"=>"Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS", "distrelease"=>"16.04", "majdistrelease"=>"16.04"}}
```

I barely know ruby but looking at the gem source: https://www.rubydoc.info/gems/facter/Facter/Core/Execution/Base
i can not see how this **timeout** option should work since the command is executeded by statement
```
out = %x{#{expanded_command}}.chomp
```

title: FreeBSD compatibility
(FM-8179) Set up CI with Azure Pipelines
Add Archlinux compatibility
Fix multiple xtrabackup regressions (+JIRA ticket)
last_comment:
@cmccrisken-puppet @lionce 

I've added the following to this PR:

* acceptance tests for xtrabackup
* merged #1244 into this PR (in order to be able to add complete acceptance tests)
* fixed default of `$xtrabackup_package_name` on CentOS 6 (which was revealed by new acceptance tests)
* added xtrabackup information to the README

One step closer, only two CI failures that I can't explain:

*  [PLATFORMS=deb_puppet5](https://travis-ci.org/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/jobs/633456358) reports an issue that does not seem to be related to my changes.
*  [PLATFORMS=el6_puppet5](https://travis-ci.org/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/jobs/633456361) fails to fetch the Percona repository metadata.

Any advice on these two issues? :)

title: change split on whitespace to split on tab in mysql_user
last_comment:
The documentation on mysql's website only goes back as far as 5.5, it has tab separation for the batch-mode output.

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/mysql-command-options.html#option_mysql_batch

>--batch, -B
>
>Print results using tab as the column separator, with each row on a new line. With this option, mysql does not use the history file.
>
>Batch mode results in nontabular output format and escaping of special characters. Escaping may be disabled by using raw mode; see the description for the --raw option.

The spec test seems to have been spaces since it was refactored from `database_user`, so I think this is actually broken in the real world, it's just lucky that the commonly used fields rarely if ever have spaces.

Surely I can't be the first person to have issues with the TLS config though (unless I'm also the first to use a TLS CA with spaces in the name).

(MODULES-8201) Add pending reboot due to domain join for windows.
last_comment:
So this is a pretty interesting (and useful!) addition to the module. Thanks @razorbladex401 !

Oddly, there appears to be scant information on this particular registry key (https://serverfault.com/a/735854), though some prior art at https://gallery.technet.microsoft.com/scriptcenter/Get-PendingReboot-Query-bdb79542 provided by a Microsoft employee

The changelog there states

```
 07/27/2015:
-Added Domain Join detection to PendComputerRename, DOES NOT currently detect Workgroup Join/Change.
```

So I'm inclined to believe this is a legitimate thing to check for, but we may want to do a little vetting here manually (it will be difficult to vet this in an automated fashion given it requires a domain)

title: (WIP) Add volatile_fact() function
last_comment:
So, there are issues with getting the facts if not set in scope as `$facts`, a) risk of getting server side facts when called on master and b) if there are many "deferred facts" they would all result in running Facter and this would be slow c) since each call will run Facter, the values may differ for the same fact
 
The best would be if the facts were already present in scope when deferred calls are resolved. That requires a change to Puppet however as the setup and use of PAL on the agent side for resolution of Deferred must be given the facts to use. (The rest should already be supported by PAL; i.e. setting `$facts` etc.)

If not computed and set up front, then I think the result needs to be cached and kept while resolving deferred values. This would be good since if there is no call to get a deferred fact then Facter does not need to run at all. If going this route, there is a supported caching mechanism that functions can use. With this there is still the problem of getting the wrong facts (for server when agent was intended) as the place intention is known is when setting up the context (i.e. when setting up PAL for resolution, or when setting up for apply, master compile, bolt apply compile, etc.).

title: (MODULES-8732) Cron types
last_comment:
Surprise! I'm not dead. The rest of 2019 just went insane.

@pegasd Thanks! Those spec tests helped me get going with my own. :) I've also corrected the newline issue you mentioned concerning proper support for puppet-strings.

I could use some feedback on whether or not to allow leading zeroes. Cron has no issue with them, but due to the potential for bugs in Puppet-related code (such as https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/MODULES-7786) I decided to remove support for them.

These tests should pass and if they do, please let me know how this is looking. I'd appreciate some help testing this more extensively before it's merged, just because it's stdlib.

title: Make type aliases stricter
last_comment:
By `breaking compatibility` I mean that if I update the `Stdlib::Compat::*` types, they will not match the behavior of corresponding functions.

I guess I could update those as well, but as I said, they're very much legacy and things may break for users in unexpected ways.

What do you propose? I can take a stab at `compat` if needed.

title: (maint) Add op_command task for executing arbitrary operational commands
last_comment: type=op is for performing any command in operational mode - which is the default CLI for the system.  The entire purpose of this task is to allow users to pass in *any* operational CLI command as if they were on the terminal.  This is similar to what has already been merged into cisco_ios 'cli_command'

title: add new types: panos_decryption_policy_rule, panos_application_group, panos_custom_url_category, and panos_profiles_url_filtering
last_comment: I added examples that I took from production devices and modified the names, but I cannot run the acceptance, because the server that has access to the devices doesn't have a version of rubby recent enough. Could you please run it and tell me if there is something wrong.
